alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Highland; Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:57AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE, NORTHWESTERN PIKE, NORTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 645 AM EDT... At 557 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Leesburg, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Greenfield, Leesburg, Bainbridge, Pike Lake, North Folk Village, Good Hope, Frankfort, South Salem, Bourneville, East Monroe, Lattaville, Austin, Buchanan, Paint Creek State Park, Summithill, Knockemstiff, Massieville, New Martinsburg and Plano. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
